Posts.Content: Originally Posted by ASAdvocate While I am not a CK patient, I have read hundreds of posts about psa bounces following radiation treatments. It is expected, and can continue for up to three years. There are opinions on typical patterns, timings, and post-nadir rises, if any. But, the bounces are part of the treatment process. Thanks for the reply! My oncologist called and unfortunately isn't all that familiar with CK, since he wasn't involved in my CK treatments(longstory), but the majority of what I read does say the same as you mentioned. It's been about 14 months since my last treatment and it's gone from 0.83 to 1.48 in 6 months. I waiting on a call back from someone I consulted with from MSK who wound up doing the CK and see what their take is.
Posts.Title: PSA Bounce Post CK

Posts.Title: PSA Bounce Post CK

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Michael F Welcome PP205! Take solace in the info provided by our data guru: Forum Brother (FB) DjinTonic! For the education of The Forum, please let us know: - Age - PSA history - Biopsy Results - Factors that led to your decision to undergo Cyberknife - Cyberknife experience May your next PSA be <1.48! MF Thanks MF, Age was 53 when diagnosed. I had 5 cores cancerous. I was originally going have the radical surgery but got scared seeing/reading all the bad stories and so far everything aside from this increase in PSA has been good.
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 07/17 4 cores cancerous Gleason4+3 PSA 3.74 Goven all options and decided on CK at MSK NYC after 3 months PSA down to 0.98 6 months later PSA down to 0.89 6 months later PSA went up to 1.48
Posts.Title: PSA Bounce Post CK

Posts.Content: Hello All, Just wondering if anyone has had their PSA bounce like I've read about post CyberKnife?
Posts.Title: PSA Bounce Post CK

Posts.Content: Hello All, Just wondering if anyone has had their PSA bounce like I've read about post CyberKnife?
Posts.Title: PSA Bounce Post CK

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by DjinTonic Hi PP205. Here are two recent papers on SBRT (CK) and PSA bounce: PSA Bounce after Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy for Prostate Cancer: Pooled Analysis from 4 SBRT Trials Evaluating Different Time-Dose-Fraction Schedules [2018] Reduced PSA Surveillance Following SBRT for Favorable Prostate Cancer Decreases the Incidence of Anxiety-Promoting Benign PSA Bounces without Limiting the Early Detection of Biochemical Failures [2018] Djin Thanks much Djin!
Posts.Signature: Diagnosed 07/17 4 cores cancerous Gleason4+3 PSA 3.74 Goven all options and decided on CK at MSK NYC after 3 months PSA down to 0.98 6 months later PSA down to 0.89 6 months later PSA went up to 1.48
